Explanations about Options.-acodec(M): Set the audio codec. This is an alias for "-codec:a".
Explanations about Options.-i(C): For example command for resize: "ffmpeg -i in.ogv -vf "crop=500:250:13:0" out.ogv".
Explanations about Options.-vf(M): Create the filtergraph specified by filtergraph and use it to filter the stream.
Explanations about Options.-vn(M):
As an input option, blocks all video streams of a file from being filtered or being
 automatically selected or mapped for any output. See "-discard" option to disable
 streams individually.

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Remux MKV video to MP4 without re-encoding audio or video streams
Top-3 Scripts:
so_42034036: ffmpeg \
-f lavfi -i "color=c=black:s=720x406:r=25:sar=1/1:d=13" \
-f lavfi -t 1 -i anullsrc=cl=stereo:r=16000 \
-i input.mp4 \
-filter_complex \
"[2:v]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS[video]; \
 [0:v][1:a][video][2:a]concat=n=2:v=1:a=1[v][a]" \
 -map "[v]" -map "[a]" output.mp4

au_487496: -f: format for input file, x11grab for recording screen

-r: rate(or bitrate).
-t: time, as seconds(500) or HH:MM:SS.[XXX](eg 01:04:59 or 01:56:43.111)
-i: input, here :0.0 generally
Finally the output file name
